Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cheerio9
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to the Rialto bridge so you can never get too lost ! The sisters that run this hotel are beautiful and will do anything to help. Rooms are a great size and very clean. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Our second April in a row in this home away from home”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidFromDC
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a value hotel in ultra-expensive Venezia (relatively, I consider anything under $200/night a value in Venice), you have found home. This is a small hotel, ten rooms, located in a very narrow calle. The location is wonderful - one minute walk to Ponte Rialto, ten minute walk to Piazza San Marco, and right in the middle of the city so you can wander Venezia until your feet hurt - yet the short walk down the narrow calle transforms the sights and sounds from busy and touristy to quiet and tranquil very quickly. The rooms are on the small side, decorated simply with Venetian style (i.e., Murano glass, etc.) and are very clean. What sets this value hotel apart from others is the location and the wonderful sisters who run it. Within 30 seconds of arriving we felt like we were returning home rather than visiting a hotel. I can't describe how helpful, friendly, informative and genuinely charming both Ambra and Stefania are. When they listen attentively to you, whether it be a request for a restaurant, directions, or just talking about venetians, it's a real pleasure to listen. They recommended our favorite restaurant in Venice which is not top ten TA, called "Al No No". The location and price of San Salvador are great, but Ambra and Stefania are what make San Salvador really special. Next trip to Venice will be our third stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for weekend in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Bagful
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Salvador for 3 nights and were very happy about our choice. It is a very simple small 2 star hotel, but the service provided and value for the deal is excellent. It is located very close to the Rialto bridge, which is a perfect place to stay since it is away from the hords of tourists at Piazza San Marco, and close to the best restaurants in town. Is is tucked in on a street so narrow that you can touch houses on both sides at the same time. No breakfast service was provided but there is a nice litttle terrace where you can sit and enjoy a glass of wine (byo) e.g. The sisters at the reception our very helpful and guided us to avoid the normal toursist traps of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days and had a great experience. It was extremely well-located, being near the Ponte di Rialto. The room I had was on the first floor of the hotel. It was small, as expected for a European hotel, but had all the amenities - A/C, a TV, ensuite bathroom. I never had any trouble sleeping despite the restaurant down below. The sisters who run the hotel - the best part. They were helpful in getting me to the self-service laundry (not too far away!) as well as a great recommendation for dinner. I would definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: drsushant161
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a decent place for a short trip to amazing Venice. The best part is the proximity to Rialto as well as the Saint Marcus square. It is located in a very narrow lane and can easily be missed if you dont know the exact directions. The hotel staff was kind enough to send us the directions on email in advance. Enjoy the Rialto in the evening with the gondolas passing by, a delicious Italian dinner by the canal is really romantic. You get into the memories of the Hindi film "The Great Gambler" with Amitabh Bachchan singing "Do Labzon ki hai" in a Gondola or the film "The Tourist" with Angelina Jolie and Johnny Depp. The downside of the Hotel is that the staircare is steep, there is no lift and the AC was non functioning in the heat of August.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at for 2 nights and is great place, excellent location, near rialto, public transport, plenty of restaurants, host are great!!, wifi connection super, very very clean, quiet, very good breakfast, i would stay again absolutely. Air conditioning in rooms are not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, CLEAN but you compromise on: privacy- very thin walls,space,and hot showers”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer4742
Reviews.Content: OK-This hotel has a great location- and YES as everyone states Amber and her sister are very nice, and the men that work the front desk do not speak any English. We stayed for almost a week and had a double room, it was small so you better love your room mate- The Good- The Location, it was very clean and Amber and her sister who worked the front desk and they were so sweet to even apologize for the weather the day it rained. Around the corner is the Devil's Forest Pub- which has a very good 14 Euro Bottle of house wine, sports on the 3 TVs, and good snack food- and guess what real Venetians! Not just tourists--- The Bad- There was not enough hot water- you only had about 2 minutes- I literally took to putting the shampoo in my hand before I entered to save the 10 seconds- as I always ended with a cold shower to rinse my hair. Second very big downer- THIN WALLS- we could hear everyone and they could hear us- we knew where our neighbors were going for the day and what tv show they had on- if you are very light sleeper- you need to really consider this before staying for any period of time--Travelling light for Venice is good- put BRING YOUR TOILETRIES!! They do not provide shampoo, conditioner,shower gel-I went to the store and had to buy my own. On the the hairdryer--if you have thick, long hair consider bringing a hairdryer. It took almost 20 minutes what take 6 or 7 at home to get my hair dry. If I knew that I would have traded the weight for the time.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in Venice that's easy to find!”
Reviews.Author: janmg
Reviews.Content: It was so nice to have a hotel that took minutes to find rather than hours! The Disney store is on the corner of the little street and the hotel has a sign on it's "bridge" over the street. The only tricky thing is that the front door looks like it is part of a house, so when you see the "bridge" stop and look to the right. Look on the list of tenants and push the buzzer for the hotel and they'll let you right in. There is a set of steep steps into the lobby and some of the rooms cross that bridge and are up another set of steps. So pack light! I loved the central location that made it easy to stop by to drop things off or rest for a minute. And wherever you are in the city just follow the signs for the Rialto Bridge to get back. So easy! The sisters are very friendly and speak great English. The men on duty at night don't speak much English but are very nice. The room is small, but this is Venice. The shower is tiny! I had a single room and the bed was more like a double. And having the minifridge to hold a drink and an extra piece of pizza was nice. If you want to spend your days seeing Venice, not sitting in your hotel room, you can't beat the location or price of this hotel. And I slept great here too!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Megantodd
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean. The Italian bath towels were fantastic and gave a real authentic feel. Our room was very spacious with a big bathroom. Amazing to walk out the front door and have the rialto bridge at your disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Clean and Safe, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cats_Pajamas_99
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the San Salvador. As a single traveler, I felt very secure and safe there. It was a perfect location and a good price. The staff were friendly and helpful. (The night desk clerk didn't know any English but we communicated well with sign language and my attempts at Italian.) It was nice to find a single room available in Venice. My room was clean and comfortable. There was some noise at night from an adjacent restaurant but it didn't bother my sleep. I was on the go constantly. Being by the Rialto Bridge was a great location for exploring the city and easily finding my way back on foot or by vaporetto. Sometimes you just want to change shoes, drop off packages, or relax a few minutes before going out at night. The location made that possible. I purchased a 48 hour vaporetto pass so it made the trips convenient and affordable. I'd definitely stay there again without hesitation. When I left to travel Florence, it was only a 10 minute vaporetto ride to the train station. When I arrived in Venice, I took a water taxi from the airport directly to the Rialto stop. It was an easy walk to the square but a bit of a challenge to find the hotel. It's down a pedestrian passage way (past some public phones on the wall) just before the Disney store. There's a hotel sign at foot level pointing the way. There isn't a sign coming out of the wall at or above eye level. As you walk down the passage you need to look for the number "5264" over the door.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: mzhoque
Reviews.Content: This is a centrally located hotel near to the Rialto Bridge. You can't go wrong with this place- it is not fancy, but clean and service is very good. The wash rooms are small but manageable. Location is fantastic and very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful little gem this is, clean, great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Weintime1
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying 2 nights here at the Hotel San Salvador in Venice. It is ideally located a short walk from everything. Rooms a very clean and quite a good size for Venice. There is even a fridge in the room and the drinks and water in it are as cheap as you will buy from the shops. The bathroom is clean and very nice. There was even a chandelier in the room, just so cute. We just loved it here, and just so cheap. We drove our car and left it at Trochetto very safe and then caught the ACTV vaporetto 2 and got of at Rialto Bridge, from there it was only a few minutes walk to the hotel, very easy to find. Of a night it was great to be right in the heart of Venice after all the day trippers had gone back to the Lido. Definitely a must to stay here, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MannyFromNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an excellent are but is a little tricky to find as are most places in the maze known as Venice. The receptionist was very friendly and gave us excellent directions to help us navigate our way to the hotel and once we got the hang of it, we easily found our way around the city. The room was kept very clean and tidy and it was great to have bathrooms in our room which is a huge plus. Our only cons were that the air conditioner wasnt cool enough for the hot days of July but we were able to get a nice breeze by keeping the windows open at night and the fact that we had to pay for internet . Other than that, we enjoyed our stay there and appreciate the front desks help in pointing us to the beach when we were ready to relax for a day.

Reviews.Title: “Well located functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: denniskapoor
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel. Near Rialto and nice restaurants. Room is pretty functionals and so is bathroom - its in good condition but not modern. Staff was very helpful with recommendations and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: tradertpc
Reviews.Content: A man in the rail station pushed this place on us and I should have known it wouldnt turn out well. The directions he gave us were poor and we had to ask around to find the place. We told the guy at the station we would take 2 nights. Got to the Hotel and the man at the desk told us we could only get one night. His English was very poor. The room was tiny. If you are from the states don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Eurotrippa
Reviews.Content: The lady at the desk was so nice, and made an effort to let us know early that there was a strike so we may need to found other transport to the train station. Location is perfect. Rooms very small but to be expected. Hard to find but so is everything in Venice :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cemw
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in May. The room & bathroom are tiny but are ok if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and leave your bags. The location is fantastic and price also reasonable for Venice. The girls on the front desk were very warm & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't want to book anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Cherry_char
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and staffed by the loveliest people, who are warm, friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room that is situated in an apartment that they also own. The room was beautifully decorated in traditional Venetian style giving an air of sophistication and romance. Clean room and bathroom which were serviced daily and provided with fresh towels. The location is perfect as it is a 2 minute walk away from the Rialto Bridge and about 5 minutes from San Marco Square, making it perfect for dropping off all those shopping bags in between shops! Right from the first contact that I made with the hotel through to leaving we were treated exceedingly well by Ambra & Stefania and look forward to our return visit in October and of course there is nowhere else we would want to stay! Our new home away from home! There is only one word for this hotel - PERFETTO!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JamiecEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and as soon as we were greeted by the girl that runs it (Sorry but the name escapes me at the moment) we knew we had made the right decision to stay at The San Salvador. Nothing was too much trouble for them and we were always given a warm welcome with a huge smile. I can honestly fault nothing about this hotel apart from the hard bed but that all is down to personal preference not the fault of the hotel. we have decided to book there again when we go back to Venice in October to get married. The location couldnt be any better either, 2 minutes from the Rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff - fantastic location - can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: CBMFMG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the separate apartment block to this hotel, as the main hotel building was fully occupied - testament to how good the place is! Location - I doubt you could get better for the same price. As close to the Rialto as you can get without actually being on the grande canal, and also only a 5 minute walk to the Piazza - this hotel is ideally situated for sightseeing! Staff - Extremely friendly! The lady on reception was very helpful - gave us lots of tips on where to eat cheaply but well, and what to do while in Venice. The rooms were immaculately cleaned, and all staff we encountered always smiled and said hello. Rooms - We were in the last available room in the apartment hotel, having arrived somewhat unexpectedly in Venice without accommodation! The room was admittedly quite a small double, but it had everything we needed so we were very pleased. The bed was very comfortable, the wardrobe was a good size - can't fault it! We also shared a bathroom, which we weren't particularly looking forward to, but in fact the shared bathroom was always sparkling clean, and there was no need to worry! (It was actually only shared with one other room, so there were never any issues of having to wait to use it) In summary - this hotel's location is ideal for tourists. The staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to help you. The room I had wasn't what you would call luxury, but for 60 euros a night over Easter I think I really got more than my money's worth!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with clean rooms run by charming sisters”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidFromDC
Reviews.Content: San Salvador is everything we hoped for and more! I would classify it as a value hotel, but the location and cleanliness and charm of our room was more than I expected. The sisters who run the hotel are the kind of people you hope will run your hotel - genuine, helpful and charming. We chose two top-10 TA-recommended restaurants by ourselves and asked the sisters for a recommendation for the third - Al No No, across the Ponte Rialto - which is a two minute walk from the hotel - and Al No No was our favorite for both ambiance and food. Next time we visit Venice we will definitely stay here again. Note - they do not have a restaurant or even coffee service in the hotel, but if you like to go-go-go from early in the morning to late at night, and want a clean, comfortable place to lay your head at a value price - and so close to Rialto and Piazza San Marco, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location! Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jeab_St_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really charming. The room is very clean and has all the amenities 3-star hotels do. As a bonus, I got the room with a view of a canal. The location is the best for the price I paid, extremely close to Rialto bridge. It was also very easy to find, the entry way is right next to Disney Store. The 2 wonderful ladies Ambra and her sister couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. It makes my trip even more pleasant. Ambra gave me brochures and info about the city upon checking-in without me even asking. I arrived in Venice the last day of Carnivale '11 so it was a surprise to see tons of teenage tourists in the city but I did get to see how Italians party. All the costumes they put on and the DJs and music was so much fun. The next day I get to see the real Venice in its normal atmosphere. What a sight! I felt really lucky to get to see the best of both world. All in all, I enjoyed my stay here very much. Friendly staff, clean room, great location in a beautiful city, could ask for better than this! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - No breakfast or service - Small rooms and bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: ZebWin51
Reviews.Content: Very diificult to find (only 1 metal door, no sign in a 1,5 meters large way). Very good emplacement to go to major Venice sites (close to Rialto an San Marco Place) Small and tight rooms - Very small bathroom, the shower is very tight for normal sized persons. No breakfast possible, you have to go outside and walk with your "takeaway breakfast" which is at least 50 to 200 meters walking. No service in the room (coffee or teabags and hot water...) This is a pity for such and expensive 2 stars Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Winstonng
Reviews.Content: Few minutes walk from the Rialto bridge. Rooms are of reasonable size, staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Great service”
Reviews.Author: MelJim2510
Reviews.Content: The ladies (and gent) we encountered were all extremely helpful; lent us an umbrella during a rainy evening, let us keep our luggage there while we strolled the streets. The room we had was, although very tiny, very clean. The bed was comfortable. Not much room for 2 persons and luggage but we made do. Would stay again and recommend it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Top location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: First the good bits, the hotel is really easy to find and well located just off the end of the Rialto bridge, the staff speak excellent english and all were very friendly and helpful and more than happy to recommend places to eat, etc. The rooms are a little small, but the bed was big and comfy enough. The shower is small an so is the bathroom but if you're in Venice how much time will you spend in the room??? The hotel itself and the side we stayed on was very quiet, there was some noise from the apartment upstairs but it was always early evening. The towels are a bit odd but they work and the room was very clean and cleaned every day. There is a small fridge too which comes in handy. Overall the room isn't exceptional but it does the job and the location and staff is brilliant. You will find better hotels/rooms but they're either further away or a lot more expensive. We emailed the hotel direct and got a very good rate. Wifi is available but it's quite expensive and the internet cafe you pick the signal up from is just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a good sleep, and towels don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: sj_begonja
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this place is over priced. Cons: The room we had [number 12] is so small, there was not enough room on the floor or anyplace for both of us to put our bags down and open them up at the same time. They provide cut down sheets as towels. It's so noisy, morning noon and night there is commotion on both sides of the street and within the hotel, which is in an apartment block. The shower is so small, I could hardly fit - and I am no giant, Pros Great location to San Marco, Rialto and surrounds. All a few mins walk away Fabulous staff - super friendly Overall I'd stay further away from San Marco and get better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “No hidden surprises - just good value!”
Reviews.Author: OzzieAllison
Reviews.Content: Like almost everyone else, we found this hotel on trip advisor and liked that it seemed genuine and good value. And that is what we found. We spent a weekend, it was easy to get to off the vaporetto, great quiet location - wherever we were, we knew we only needed to get back to Rialto stop to find our way back to the hotel. The two sisters are fantastic(even the night man who spoke no English was accomodating and found me two more pillows when I asked.). Yes the rooms are compact, the bathroom is small - but it all works, and was spotlessly clean!(the bath towels are cotton sheets - strange, but surprisingly they work!) Having a mini fridge was a bonus. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and extremely friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: fabvizc
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a weekend trip to Venice. The room might be to small for more that 4 days. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Always smiling! The location is excellent, right in the middle of all the main attractions. Also, it is a minute away from the Rialto Bridge, which is really convenient when going to the other districts of Venice on the opposite side of the Grand Canal. Only thing that I found kind of weird was the handkerchief type towels. They did the job of drying us out, but I prefer regular towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ratkovic70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 1 night at this hotel in June, 2010. The room was small but adequate and the bathroom/shower clean. The location was outstanding just a few hundred yards from Rialto Bridge. The young lady at the reception desk was extremely friendly and cheerful. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in the middle of Venice but doesn't need a lot of amenities or want to spend a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: mccheese
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel. We stayed in early Jun for three nights. The staff was extremely friendly and is family run, gave us a great restaurant recommendation and accommodated us with our early 5 a.m. check out to catch an early train. The rooms were immaculately kept. The bathrooms, and shower were small (wouldn't recommend for overweight or very tall people), but that's Venice. We had no issues with cleanliness and our sheets were changed daily the minute we left the room. That guy with bed bugs probably brought them there himself.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG INFESTATION -- AVOID THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MLCCC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located and the staff are reasonably pleasant, but I realized after waking up with several bites all over exposed areas of my body and looking at the mattress and walls that the room was infested with bed bugs. Upon questioning, the night staffer claimed that the bites came from mosquitoes and that he had never heard of bed bugs. The daytime staffer had heard of bedbugs and knew whom to call, but claimed she had never heard of them at this hotel. Unlikely, given the insect fecal stains on the walls below the mattress. They essentially accused me of bringing the bugs in and refused to refund any money. Not worth the relatively cheap price and great location, unless you do a thorough room inspection beforehand.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel San Salvador
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 5264 | Calle Galliazzo, 30124 Venice, Italy
